turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: --<u>Who</u> <u>is</u> <u>he</u>?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I'll need any and all topographic studies.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Wait just a second.  You don't just fly in here and start barking orders.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I apologize, I just don't want to lose the light, we've got time for a quick scout,  you've had work done.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: They've been migrating north, Kelly, this lake connects to the ocean,--

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Mr. Cyr!

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: C'mon, we're losing light,  why does the big one heckle me?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I really don't mean to be discourteous.  But how is it a person could come to believe that a crocodile is in New England?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: They have saltwater glands, they can swim across oceans, it's only a matter of time.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: And what would he do come winter?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: They can survive winter.  As long as their nostrils don't freeze, they survive,  am I foolish to explain things, he had such trouble with my name?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Around here.  Yeah.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: If he's eaten in the area, he shouldn't be far away.  Crocs hang around the food source.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: We'd only just met.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Well, you've got a croc alright, they're keystone species.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Keystone what?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Species, keystones affect the entire ecosystem, that could explain all these worms, the water. You've got a crocodile.  Bury your friend.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: We are here on official business.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Cocktail?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: <u>No</u>!!  What's with digging the holes?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: They come on land and they're brazen.  They're also attracted to noise, you can see I make a lot of it.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Everybody out, back to your tents, <u>now</u>!

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Could <u>she</u> stay, we've tentatively scheduled intercourse.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: No!!  Out!

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: You listen to me.  The only reason I'm letting you be part of this is 'cause you got the helicopter and the radar--

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: And you like me.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I do <u>not</u> like you.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Deep down, gut check.  I'm growing fond of <u>you</u> and it's liberating to say so.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Jesus Christ!!

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?!!

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: What are <u>you</u> doing?!

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: You're crawling around like a--

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I'm laying a spring trap!

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: A spring trap!

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I keep telling you, they <u>can</u> come on land, I don't wanna wake up in the middle of the night--

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I coulda shot you, you--

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: This could end up saving your life,--

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Again, I don't mean to be annoying with my questions.  But if it <u>is</u> a crocodile which I don't think it is.  And if they <u>do</u> charge these baby hatchling sounds...  why exactly would you want to be underwater at the time?  With you it makes sense.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: They don't really attack underwater and--

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: That "Walt" guy got hit underwater--

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: No crocodile has ever--

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Again.  Not to be disruptive.  Do we have a problem with it dying?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Crocodiles don't sever with their teeth, their molars are blunt.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Is this a trick?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: What I'm saying is <u>if</u> it's a crocodile that cut a man in half he would have to be over twenty feet which would make him well over a hundred years old, it would be unthinkable to destroy him.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I brought a pork chop, maybe we could hang it around your neck for luck.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: No thank you, but maybe later you can chew the bark off my big fat log.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Was he a good man?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Whenever somebody dies I consider it such a waste that I didn't know him better.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: His head was just... bitten off.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I used to have this recurring nightmare that I was headless.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: This is a setback.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: You don't want to cut me down. 'Cause I'll kill you.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Promise you won't kill me, first.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I have no interest in ever looking at you, Hector.  Could you please cut me down?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Asia?  How... how could he get here?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Obviously some asshole in Hong Kong flushed him down a toilet.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Maybe he doesn't play well with others.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Is everything a big fucking joke to you?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: <u>Bite</u> <u>my</u> <u>bishop</u>.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: It came from across the lake.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Just spit him back out.  Some shall live, some shall die, arbitrarily, sound like any higher power we know?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: He didn't eat the kid cause he'd just swallowed a bear.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Sobek.  Half man, half croc, oldest God--

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I'm tired, Hector.  I know this because you're beginning to not bug me.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: That <u>sounds</u> good but underneath it's hurtful.  Nightcap?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Raincheck.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I can arrest you!!

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Then do it!!

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: You probably <u>do</u> want to be killed by it, that was you trying to meet your maker.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: So profound and fat.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Gee, that would really disappoint me.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Forget about him being God, he's thirty feet long, he <u>is</u> a miracle of nature, who somehow made his way to Maine.  This is a grand beast. <u>A</u> <u>grand</u> <u>dragon</u>.  An attempt should at least be made to capture him alive.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I just have this feeling everything's totally safe.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I see blood.  Maybe you got him, Hank.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Where is he?!

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I don't know!

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: At school they'd always say "go" first.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Get your big gun and guard the shore.  Hector.  Go to your tent.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: He never said "go".

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Get the gun.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This time, <u>I'm</u> gonna kick your ass.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Bastard bit my chopper.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hey!!

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Let's not overlook he didn't eat me, maybe--

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: 'Cause he just ate a cow, you stupid--

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, you can try talking them into that, if--

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I have enough flaxedil with me to put him out.  And I think I know a way to--

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: <u>Forget</u> <u>it</u>.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Look.  I know I'm crazy, but when they come, they will kill it.  They have to, politically, he's too dangerous, if something were to go wrong... the odds are he will be destroyed,--

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Jack.  We've all seen it.  He's probably a hundred and fifty years old, he's bigger than an elephant.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So maybe Wildlife will try to save him, they're more equipped to--

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: We both know what they'll do.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And again.  How would you get him on land?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: That's actually the easy part.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Keep enough tension to hold him up, Hector, we don't know if he can swim.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The more he thrashes, the better.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: You ready on shore?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We're ready.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I got something on the screen.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where?  Where?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Thirty meters or so.  Moving slow, but straight toward Elsie.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Can you confirm visually or just radar?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Radar, he's underwater.  But he's definitely coming.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay.  Lead him in.  Okay, everybody up on the trucks. We aim for the stomach or side... there's little chance the darts will pierce his hide.  <u>Everybody</u> <u>up</u> <u>on</u> <u>the</u> <u>trucks</u>.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Almost here, Hector.  Don't forget to lift up the cow.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Thank you, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You shoot on my order.  If he charges, I'll be yelling "go" which means drivers take off.  And drive fast, they can move on land.  You set?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tranq guns down, rifles up!

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: <u>No</u>.  Look.  He's got nothing left.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah and every time we think there's no more danger--

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You take care.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: You talk to Bickerman?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She didn't tell us about the other croc 'cause she was afraid we'd blow it's head off.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Women's intuition.  Are there anymore?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just those two.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hector.  The big one has no sense of humor.  And since <u>he's</u> the one who decides whether you get to play, try not to be your obnoxious self.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: That hurt my feelings.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: If he's here, I'll find him.  Did she tell you we had sex together?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I never had sex with you!

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Even so, you're allowed to boast. You look thin by the way, I've mentally undressed you, I can see your ribcage.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: But they're nighttime hunters, Hector, he'd probably be on land now anyway.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: 'Cept he wasn't before, was he?  You know, when friends or family members say things, they tend not to register so sometimes it helps to hear it from a total stranger. You're fat.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>Hector</u>.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: None of us actually <u>saw</u> anything.  I realize this Sir, but something flipped us over, I doubt very much it was a mink.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Such the flirt.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: U.S. Wildlife won't send anybody without a confirmation.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You <u>should</u> take a flax pole.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: And what if I tranq him Kelly?  He drowns.  You think about that?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm just saying last resort.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Two years married, divorced, used to be a lawyer, quit, I'm still waiting on his sperm count.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What?  Oh as <u>if</u> I'm interested.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: As if.  Will you miss me?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: He was an Indo-pacific.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Scales were oval.  It was an <u>Asian</u> crocodile.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>Jack</u>!

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I'm a civilian!  You don't have any authority--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>Did</u> you want to be killed by it?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: You think I'm <u>that</u> nuts?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hector.  What you just did... there was at least some sort of a death wish going on.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Nothing's real.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: <u>Nothing's</u> real.  I'm rich, people are automatically my friends, sycophants ooze out like oil slicks and and and--

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: With crocodiles... everything's even.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm no psychiatrist.  But I would think there have to be better places to look for autonomy, than--

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I'm an empty man, Kelly, wealth has robbed me of the dream in life, I sit here broken, a hollow sack--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Oh, bullshit.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Didn't even <u>sound</u> good?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Eh.  Fuck it.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Can I tell them you won't go back in the water?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Yes.  You may.  But maybe... I don't know...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Could we have intercourse?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: They're not going to be able to snag him in pitmans.  Tranq him in water, he drowns.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: They could try to tranq him on land.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: They won't.  He's taken human life, the mission will be to put him down.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: And how would we neutralize him?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: We lure him on land and pump him with the drugs.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I'm okay.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You're not okay, your leg's a mess.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You're gonna be okay.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Guess I finally got bit.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yeah, you got bit.  I'm gonna fix it.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: He's gonna live?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yeah.  Thanks to you.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: And Hank.  I know you weren't really trying to hit him.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Kelly Scott.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jack Wells.  A museum sent you?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Are we all museum bigots in Maine?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Did you make anything of the tooth?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yes, it <u>did</u> seem prehistoric but I'm sure he just carried the thing for luck.  Not that it <u>worked</u>, obviously.  It probably somehow got lodged into his body.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Excuse me.  One other thing, it's a <u>small</u> point, but... I have a thing about being humored, and I'm feeling humored, more by <u>him</u>, but you seemed quick to join in.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ma'am, your first impression isn't going well.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: How big do the bears get?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Big but... a bear couldn't do that to a moose or man in <u>water</u>.  On <u>land</u> maybe.  But...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: And they're sure he didn't get tangled under the outboard somehow?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hank <u>says</u> he's sure.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: It really is beautiful, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Never been to Maine before?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I was told they discriminate against people with hygiene.  I never <u>believed</u> it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why are you here?  Really.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I <u>told</u> you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The Museum of Natural History doesn't send out investigators to--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: How would <u>you</u> know, what--

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And even if they <u>did</u>, I doubt <u>he</u> or <u>she</u> would have problems with <u>tents</u>.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: So I don't like tents, why--

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You don't like tents, mosquitos, look at your fingernails, you have about as much business being in the woods--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm not making it up.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well.  You don't have to <u>stay</u> out <u>here</u>, why don't--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I've come, I'm here, I'm staying. Unless there are ticks.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Oh my God.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: If this is who I <u>think</u> it is.  It <u>is</u>.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hector Cyr.  He's a rich kook mythology professor.  He's done some work with our museum.  He also treks the world to swim with crocodiles.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: In Maine?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: There <u>have</u> been Northern sightings. But not <u>this</u> North.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Same thing from Fish And Game.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>Something's</u> in that water.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well until we see it, we're not gonna be convincing too many people.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Baby crocs?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Adult males will charge hatchlings. If there's one out there...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If one could be out there... why does Fish And Game tell me it's impossible?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Because they just consult their little indigenous charts.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He could be right there and you wouldn't see him.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'd be able to see something.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Skipping stones.  Look how flat that water is, you can get ten skips on a good one.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Listen, uh... Hank and I think it best if you stay on shore.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I beg your pardon?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Whatever's out there <u>did</u> flip over a canoe--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I am <u>not</u> staying on shore.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's too dangerous for--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I didn't fly up here to roast marshmallows--

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You flew up here because your boss--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I am going out on that boat and why are you picking on me, is this some kind of--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: That was an awful thing to say to me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sorry but you're...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay.  We're up at six.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: 'Night.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He thinks they're what?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: In his defense, every primitive culture known to man deified them. He's a mythology professor, he thinks crocs are divine conduits.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: They respond pretty quick.  I'll wait till you get down before I turn it on.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Good.  See ya soon.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Good luck.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You okay?  Kelly?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yeah.  Nobody saw <u>anything</u>?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.  U.S. Wildlife is on their way.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: That's probably good.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Police want to keep it quiet, if the press gets word... lake monster.  They just want us to sit tight.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: <u>Are</u> you okay?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Um... y'know...  Yeah.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hard to believe there could be a monster under such peacefulness.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I thought I might track the shoreline tomorrow, look for prints.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You know they say the brain confuses fear for passion.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: When you get scared, the brain releases a chemical, same chemical it releases when somebody's...  in high school, the thing to do was to take the girl to a scary movie.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm saying between the moonlight, a beautiful lake <u>and</u> a monster that bites heads off... you look good.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Gee, that was so poetic, Jack.  I'm all moist.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Forgive me for trying to be nice.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Nice?  Nice would be "you look pretty," nice is not some man- eating monster has tricked my brain into making you look good.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I didn't say it like that.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You <u>did</u>, you--

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I was trying to pay you a compliment, I was guising it as science 'cause I know you're comfortable in that arena. Science.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: A man just died, you're hitting on me with science.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just forget it.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Why he's that <u>big</u>, I don't know. Why he's <u>here</u>... the wetlands are being developed, crocodiles are moving.  Australia, Fiji, the things have started to cross oceans.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But why <u>Maine</u> and why alone?  Crocs are social, why's this guy on the move by himself?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Like little children.  You okay?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yeah.  I got some stuff for your cut.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I couldn't believe... did you see the size of that thing's mouth?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I wonder if he's some kind of mutant.  That bear had to be surprised.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Let's get away from the shore.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: <u>Ow</u>.  Shit.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Just gotta pull it a little tighter.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who taught you be be a nurse?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Father's a surgeon.  I can even stitch in a pinch, wouldn't be a bad idea here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Keep it dry.  No swimming.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're having the best time of your life, aren't you?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What?  Why... people have been killed, I hardly think I'm having a good time, why would...  Does it show?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's why you're here.  To get in the middle of something?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Maybe.  I've always <u>read</u> about what's happened.  I've never... I know it sounds silly but, it's nice to be someplace <u>while</u> something is actually... y'know... happening.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thanks for the... bandaid.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Night.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well.  Goodnight.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: We seem to say goodnight a lot.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We could <u>not</u> say it and...  Well, that thing is ambulatory if you want somebody in your tent to...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm gonna get ticks.  I know it. They're drawn to me.  I got a thing about ticks.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ssssh!

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I heard something.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Thing we can lift it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Maybe.  Don't mush it.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm not mushing it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're mushing it a little around the--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>I'm</u> <u>not</u> <u>mushing</u> <u>it</u>.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay.  Okay.  Okay.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>That</u> <u>is</u> <u>it</u>!!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Really--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>No</u>.  I keep getting hit with heads!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Calm down.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You calm down!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: <u>Calm</u> <u>down</u>.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You wanna kill yourself, that it, you looking to commit some kind of divine suicide?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Alright, Jack!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: <u>No</u>!  You might think they're Godly, you might get some spiritual lift backstrokin' with dragons but you just put a deputy at risk and--

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just heard from Wildlife and Florida Fish And Game.  They should be here by four.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We might as well pack.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Good idea.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Are we crazy?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We've got a cow hanging from a helicopter.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It can't work.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: He <u>has</u> been going after everything. It <u>could</u> work.  But this is not a happy cow.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He looks like a giant tea bag.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He doesn't seem to be swimming.  Is he swimming?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: He's floating.  Take it home.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hector.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: He's mooing.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You wouldn't?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Watch out!!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Keep firing!

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hector!!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Take him.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: We gotta get to Hector!!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Back us in a little, we need to get a shot!
